g.text: composites have been designed by taking the various combinations of ferroelectric and
composites, ME-coupling takes place at the interface of the grains during sintering therefore,
proper mechanical contact in between the grains, high piezoelectric/magnetostrictive
coefficients and high resistivity of ferroelectric as well as magnetic phases are the essential
requirement for the formation of high performance particulate composite [15,20,21].
In the present work, we have fabricated a multiferroic particulate composite by taking
-based ferroelectric solid solutions with of type

) cations which frequently forms the ferroelectric solid solutions with PbTiO
morphotropic phase boundary (MPB) which is the coexistence region of two ferroelectric
phases where the piezoelectric response gets maximized.

) structures [22]. BNT-PT has been reported to exhibit large longitudinal
